issue.title: Atlas drifting while seated in car

content.raw:
Hi Twan,

If this is a new phenomenon, the primary suspect might be [gazebo pull request #579](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/579/apply-gazebo-extensions-to-all-collisions/diff) that was merged into [gazebo 1.8.4](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Change_log#Gazebo_1.8.4_.282013-06-03.29).  This patch extends each link's SDF friction coefficient to all of its collision bodies.  Before this bug fix, only one collision body in a link has the right friction coefficient, while the rest of them defaulted to `std::numeric_limits<float>::max()`.  Can you confirm this is new since updating to drcsim 1.8.5?

Also, if available, please post a snapshot of

~~~
rostopic echo /atlas/atlas_state
~~~

of the robot in its seating pose, so I can test putting the robot in a similar pose with PID control to benchmark drift.


Possible solutions:

* increase [uleg](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/b36170c2460b645c420a8e65c0f92139bf845990/ros/atlas_description/urdf/atlas.gazebo?at=default#cl-154) and [pelvis](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/b36170c2460b645c420a8e65c0f92139bf845990/ros/atlas_description/urdf/atlas.gazebo?at=default#cl-166) collision friction coefficients,
* modify [mud seat parameters](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/b36170c2460b645c420a8e65c0f92139bf845990/gazebo_models/environments/mud_atlas/model.sdf?at=default#cl-96).


Thanks,
John
